DataElement.preferredDefinition: Codes for surgical procedures done to reconstruct, restore, or improve the shape and appearance or function of body structures that are missing, defective, damaged, or misshapen by cancer or therapies.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Surgical procedures done to reconstruct, restore, or improve the shape and appearance or function of body structures that are missing, defective, damaged, or misshapen by cancer or therapies.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: Reconstruction; surgical restoration of function or form of a part.

Concepts.definition: Surgical restoration of function or form of a part.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Surgery that is done to reshape or rebuild (reconstruct) a part of the body changed by previous surgery._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. [Explanatory Comment: See NAACCR Data Dictionary, Eleventh Edition, for coding instruction.]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Reconstruction; surgical restoration of function or form of a part.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Surgical restoration of function or form of a part.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: RX Summ--Reconstruct 1st Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: Reconstructive/restorative procedures are coded here when started during the first course of therapy. COC introduced site-specific codes for this item in the COC ROADS Manual 1998 Supplement. RX Coding System--Current [1460] identifies which coding system applies. SEER collects reconstructive procedures for breast cancer tumors only. For reconstructive/restorative procedures performed later, see Subseq RX--Reconstruct Del [1741].  See also RX Summ--Surgery Type [1640].
